caption.center: In the Matter of RICHARD T. WALKER, Appellant, v. LEANNE M. ADAMS,

court.center: Appellate Division of the Supreme Court of New York, Third Department.

opinion.posture: Mugglin, J. Appeal from an order of the Supreme Court (Lawliss, J.), entered May 13, 2005 in Clinton County, which dismissed petitioner's application, in a proceeding pursuant to Family Ct Act article 6, for modification of a prior order of custody.
opinion.panel: Before: Mercure, J.P., Carpinello, Rose and Kane, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text:
Petitioner's application for modification of a custody and visitation order was dismissed, without prejudice, for his failure to comply with a pretrial scheduling order. He appealed, but in the interim, respondent filed another petition for modification of custody and visitation and petitioner filed a cross petition seeking the same relief. In February 2006, on consent, a custody and visitation order was entered, rendering this appeal moot (see Matter of RebeccaO. v Todd P., 309 AD2d 982, 983 [2003]; Matter ofSiberio v Siberio, 208 AD2d 994, 994 [1994]).
Ordered that the appeal is dismissed, as moot, without costs.
